feed.title: Denver Homeless Out Loud
feed.subtitle: Posts from Denver Homeless Out Loud

entry.title: DPD Always ready to escalate to a fight how about learning to...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

DPD Always ready to escalate to a fight how about learning to deescalate situations for a change. Yesterday they arrested someone while they were praying claiming they were failing to comply with a "lawful" order.

Stupid is as stupid does.

Lisa Calderon is with Jeff Fard and Candi CdeBaca.

"This is where the cops told us we would be okay, and apparently we're not going to be okay."
~ Thomas Bevington, 29th & Arkins
Westword (Photos: ET Tafoya & DHOL)

entry.title: "The city does offer storage for belongings, including...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"The city does offer storage for belongings, including those that appear left behind. But the simple presence of a needle justifies the disposal of a tent, according to city guidelines"
------------
The guidelines also state they can throw a tent away for the simple appearance partially eaten food left in a tent. Almost every tent will have a half eaten sandwich or other food they were saving for later. It gives the city an excuse to toss everything with out looking very har...d. So why would they substitute a referee to something that everyone does – eat food- with something a small minority of people do – intravenous drugs-. I will offer that they are trying to shame these folks in any way possible so you (the general public) allow their cruelty to these people.

BTW after contacting 100 people no one was housed. (or they would be declaring it and bragging about how many they housed) One person we are aware of got a 72 hour hotel voucher. They will be on the street in a couple of days.

Offering services is different than meeting needs.

https://www.westword.com/…/denver-sweeps-homeless-encampmen…

See MoreDenver police officers fenced off the area to prevent protesters from entering the encampment.

westword.com

Denver Begins Sweep of Large Homeless Encampment in RiNo

Denver police officers fenced off the area to prevent protesters from entering the encampment.Denver police officers fenced off the area to prevent protesters from entering the encampment.

entry.title: Some coverage of yesterdays sweep. Not that they will...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Some coverage of yesterdays sweep.

Not that they will investigate the Denargo address suddenly due for a zoning change after over a year of this camp existing. 3520/3220 Denargo December 14th Council votes a zoning change so some bank can make some money selling the land back and forth.

You got to wonder why is is so important now during the largest COVID spike that these people suddenly be scattered. It is all about the money and the news is not reporting it.

...

I will say for his part Rick did call looking for permision to use some footage from an independent news outlet that he thought we might be able to connect him with. The footage was of a person who was arrested while praying. How about asking a few of the most obvious questions about why all this is happening in the first place?

- Why now after over a year?
- Why now during the peak of a pandemic?
- Anything happening near by that is posted on the property?
- What does that big yellow sign talking about a zoning
meeting in 2 weeks mean in regards to the timing of the sweep?
Could they have waited until the vacines come out before sweeping? They waited a year already.
- Isn't that dangerous for the city let alone against CDC guidelines?

Basic investigative type questions.

Nope. Unfortunately our local news does not take the time to investigate. Too busy selling that advertising. Now let me tell you about the new tikle me Elmo it only cost 19.99$ hurry supplies are limited. YEash!!!

https://denver.cbslocal.com/…/30/denver-sweep-homeless-camp/

See MoreThe tent-filled homeless encampment at 29th and Arkins Court was huge, filthy and the scene of a recent murder.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Denver Sweeps Large Homeless Camp As Sanctioned Homeless Site Prepares To Open

The tent-filled homeless encampment at 29th and Arkins Court was huge, filthy and the scene of a recent murder.The tent-filled homeless encampment at 29th and Arkins Court was huge, filthy and the scene of a recent murder.

entry.title: Donations needed for Encampment Residents Arrested at Sweep...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Donations needed for Encampment Residents Arrested at Sweep

Yesterday, cops arrested 4 people while sweeping the Arkins encampment. All of them were charged with "disobeying a lawful order." This means, tell police they have a right to survive or simply being where the cops don't want you.
The community is raising money to get them out of jail, and then also to get the 3 folks who are unhoused who were arrested a night in a hotel and a tent and sleeping bag.

...

You can donate on venmo at @makenalam

Two of those who were arrested spoke at the press conference on Saturday. Watch their speeches here...

Searia Speaking at Press Conferencehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yp0hq8LjtdU&fbclid=IwAR0CGPsC3tKSpK1vxLhuZitagtENR5aNnT15OKUbhu5rWIbecxXVeL5_WNs

King Speaking at Press Conferencehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8A_nWf2waHE&fbclid=IwAR0J4T7q7JqD5AS1hxQzI9Go1hzbW-aPTEdf0wRssYYqtg4vSWExZL-xABE

See More

entry.title: The SWEEP of the Arkins camp today was a disgusting display of...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The SWEEP of the Arkins camp today was a disgusting display of authority and abuse. Denver Police Department maced and pepper sprayed community volunteers who were present to advocate for the rights of the unhoused and support them in moving. There were 3 camp residents arrested and one community advocate. Approximately ⅓ of the camp was swept to nowhere. No residents were offered housing and only one resident was offered a motel voucher for only 3 days. We spoke to one resid...ent who was moving her belongings to the next spot and while she was gone, DDPHE and DPD trashed all of her remaining belongings including one of her kids’ child seats, diapers and clothing, and the family heater. DDPHE and DPD refused to be responsible and replace those necessary items for survival. We also had an overwhelming request for tents. Before leaving, the Denver Police Department left a large flood light and video set up that will remain until the end of the SWEEP which will continue tomorrow.

Your help is still needed! We will be back out tomorrow to support this camp and residents. Please come and support our unhoused community members at 29th and Arkins on Tuesday December 1st.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated. Somewhere around 6am and all day help will likely be needed.

Onward towards Rights, Dignity, Housing...

See More

Denver Homeless Out Loud

The Playlist isn't loading right... will try and fix it in the meantime here are the statements from Saturdays Press Conference. Not that mainstream media would give any attention to the largest camp in the city getting swept. Especially this close to the xmass selling season.
Remember a couple of people chose not to speak who were scheduled to, due to early police p...resence just before the press conference. Not that the media there tood notice and reported it.

entry.title: Will be collecting the news coverage of today massive sweep...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Will be collecting the news coverage of today massive sweep here. I find it strange that the mainstream media outlets are absent. They were all over the Morrey Middle School sweep this summer ... but they work in that area and many live near where they work.

https://koanewsradio.iheart.com/…/2020-11-30-denver-plans-…/

The City of Denver is planning a homeless sweep near 29th and Arkins in RiNo. We talk with Terese Howard of Denver's Homeless Out Loud, who says this sweep is a bad idea.

koanewsradio.iheart.com

Denver Plans Homeless Sweep in RiNo | KOA NewsRadio 850 AM & 94.1 FM | Colorado's Morning News

The City of Denver is planning a homeless sweep near 29th and Arkins in RiNo. We talk with Terese Howard of Denver's Homeless Out Loud, who says this sweep is a bad idea.The City of Denver is planning a homeless sweep near 29th and Arkins in RiNo. We talk with Terese Howard of Denver's Homeless Out Loud, who says this sweep is a bad idea.
